executable.title: UKF Tractography
executable.description:
This module traces fibers in a DWI Volume using the multiple tensor unscented Kalman Filter methodology. At each point on the fiber the most consistent direction is found as a mixture of previous estimates and of the local model.

For more information, please reference: Malcolm, James G., Martha E. Shenton, and Yogesh Rathi. "Filtered multitensor tractography." Medical Imaging, IEEE Transactions on 29.9 (2010): 1664-1675. (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20805043)
executable.contributor: Yogesh Rathi, Stefan Lienhard, Yinpeng Li, Martin Styner, Ipek Oguz, Yundi Shi, Christian Baumgartner, Kent Williams, Hans Johnson, Peter Savadjiev, Carl-Fredrik Westin, Lauren O'Donnell, Jessica Lee.

image.name: seedsFile
image.label: Input Label Map
image.description: Seeds for diffusion. If not specified, full brain tractography will be performed, and the algorithm will start from every voxel in the brain mask where the Generalized Anisotropy is bigger than 0.18

integer-vector.name: labels
integer-vector.label: ROI label to use for seeding
integer-vector.description: A vector of the ROI labels to be used. There are the voxel values where tractography should be seeded.

image.name: maskFile
image.label: Input brain mask
image.description: Brain mask for diffusion tractography. Tracking will only be performed inside this mask.

integer.name: seedsPerVoxel
integer.label: Seeding: Number of seeds per voxel
integer.description: Tractography parameter used in all models. Each seed generates a fiber, thus using more seeds generates more fibers. In general use 1 or 2 seeds, and for a more thorough result use 5 or 10 (depending on your machine this may take up to 2 days to run). Default: 1. Range: 0-50.

double.name: seedingThreshold
double.label: Seeding: Minimum seed FA
double.description: Tractography parameter used in all models. Seed points whose fractional anisotropy (FA) or mean signal are below this value are excluded. Default: 0.18. Range: 0-1.

double.name: stoppingFA
double.label: Stopping Criterion: Terminating FA
double.description: Tractography parameter used in tensor model. Tractography will stop when the fractional anisotropy (FA) of the tensor being tracked is less than this value. Note: make sure to also decrease the GA to track through lower anisotropy areas. This parameter is used only in tensor models. Default: 0.15. Range: 0-1.

double.name: stoppingThreshold
double.label: Stopping Criterion: Terminating mean signal
double.description: Tractography parameter used in all models. Tractography will stop when the mean signal is below this value. Default: 0.1. Range: 0-1.

integer.name: numThreads
integer.label: Tracking: Number of threads
integer.description: Tractography parameter used in all models. Number of threads used during computation. Set to the number of cores on your workstation for optimal speed. If left undefined, the number of cores detected will be used.

integer-enumeration.name: numTensor
integer-enumeration.label: Tracking: Number of tensors/orientations in model
integer-enumeration.description: Number of tensors (tensor model) or orientations (NODDI model) used

double.name: stepLength
double.label: Tracking: Step length of tractography (in mm)
double.description: Tractography parameter used in all models. Step size when conducting tractography. Default: 0.3. Range: 0.1-1.

double.name: Qm
double.label: Tracking: Rate of change of tensor direction/orientation
double.description: UKF data fitting parameter for tensor or NODDI model: Process noise for angles/direction. Defaults: Noddi-0.001; Single tensor-0.005; other-0.001. Suggested Range: 0.00001 - 0.25. Default of 0.0 indicates the program will assign value based on other model parameters.

double.name: recordLength
double.label: Output: Step length of output tractography (in mm)
double.description: Tractography parameter used in all models. Step size between points saved along fibers. Default: 0.9. Range: 0.1-4.

double.name: maxHalfFiberLength
double.label: Output: Maximum tract length (in mm)
double.description: Tractography parameter used in all models. The max length limit of the half fibers generated during tractography. A fiber is "half" when the tractography goes in only one direction from one seed point at a time. Default: 250 mm. Range: 1-500 mm.

boolean.name: recordNMSE
boolean.label: Output: Save Normalized Mean Square Error
boolean.description: Record output from data fitting: Store normalized mean square error (NMSE) along fibers.

boolean.name: freeWater
boolean.label: Tensor Model: Estimate term for free water
boolean.description: Adds a term for free water diffusion to the model. The free water model is a tensor with all 3 eigenvalues equal to the diffusivity of free water (0.003). To output the free water fraction, make sure to use the "save free water" parameter.

boolean.name: recordFA
boolean.label: Output: Save tensor FA
boolean.description: Record output from tensor model: Save fractional anisotropy (FA) of the tensor(s). Attaches field 'FA' or 'FA1' and 'FA2' for 2-tensor case to fiber.

boolean.name: recordTrace
boolean.label: Output: Save tensor trace
boolean.description: Record output from tensor model: Save the trace of the tensor(s). Attaches field 'Trace' or 'Trace1' and 'Trace2' for 2-tensor case to fiber.

boolean.name: recordFreeWater
boolean.label: Output: Save free water fraction
boolean.description: Record output from tensor plus free water model: Save the fraction of free water. Attaches field 'FreeWater' to fiber.

boolean.name: recordTensors
boolean.label: Output: Save tensors
boolean.description: Record output from tensor model: Save the tensors that were computed during tractography (if using tensor model). The fields will be called 'TensorN', where N is the tensor number. Recording the tensors enables Slicer to color the fiber bundles by FA, orientation, and so on. Recording the tensors also enables quantitative analyses.

double.name: Ql
double.label: UKF Parameter (Advanced): Rate of change of eigenvalues
double.description: UKF data fitting parameter for tensor model: Process noise for eigenvalues. Defaults: 1 tensor-300 ; 2 tensor-50 ; 3 tensor-100. Suggested Range: 1-1000. Default of 0.0 indicates the program will assign value based on other model parameters.

double.name: Qw
double.label: UKF Parameter (Advanced): Rate of change of freewater weight
double.description: UKF data fitting parameter for tensor plus free water model: Process noise for free water weights, ignored if no free water estimation. Defaults: 1 tensor-0.0025; 2 tensor-0.0015. Suggested Range: 0.00001-0.25. Default of 0.0 indicates the program will assign value based on other model parameters.

boolean.name: noddi
boolean.label: NODDI Model: Use NODDI Model
boolean.description: Use neurite orientation dispersion and density imaging (NODDI) model instead of tensor model.

boolean.name: recordVic
boolean.label: Output: Save NODDI intra-cellular volume fraction.
boolean.description: Record output from NODDI model: Store volume fraction of intra-cellular compartment along fibers.

boolean.name: recordKappa
boolean.label: Output: Save NODDI dispersion parameter (kappa)
boolean.description: Record output from NODDI model: concentration parameter that measures the extent of orientation dispersion.

boolean.name: recordViso
boolean.label: Output: Save NODDI CSF volume fraction.
boolean.description: Record output from NODDI model: Store volume fraction of CSF compartment along fibers.

double.name: Qkappa
double.label: UKF Parameter (Advanced): Rate of change of kappa value
double.description: UKF data fitting parameter for NODDI model: Rate of change of kappa (orientation dispersion) value. Higher kappa values indicate more fiber dispersion. Default: 0.01.

double.name: Qvic
double.label: UKF Parameter (Advanced): Rate of change of intracellular volume fraction
double.description: UKF data fitting parameter for NODDI model: Rate of change of volume fraction of intracellular component. Default: 0.004.

double.name: Rs
double.label: Signal Parameter (Advanced): Expected noise in signal
double.description: UKF Data Term: Measures expected noise in signal. This is used by the UKF method to decide how much to trust the data. This should be increased for very noisy data or reduced for high quality data. Defaults: single tensor/orientation-0.01; other-0.02. Suggested Range: 0.001-0.25. Default of 0.0 indicates the program will assign value based on other model parameters.

double.name: sigmaSignal
double.label: Signal Parameter (Advanced): Sigma for Gaussian interpolation of signal
double.description: UKF Data Term: Sigma for Gaussian kernel used to interpolate the signal at sub-voxel locations. Default: 0.0

boolean.name: recordState
boolean.label: Record states
boolean.description: Develop/Debug Only: Store the states along the fiber. Will generate field 'state'. The state is the model for UKF. In the case of the two tensor model, it is a ten-parameter vector.

boolean.name: recordCovariance
boolean.label: Record the covariance matrix
boolean.description: Develop/Debug Only: Store the covariance matrix along the fiber. Will generate field 'covariance' in fiber. This is the covariance from the unscented Kalman filter.

boolean.name: fullTensorModel
boolean.label: Use full tensor model
boolean.description: Develop/Debug Only: Use the full tensor model instead of the default model. The default model has both smaller eigenvalues equal, whereas the full model allows 3 different eigenvalues.

double.name: maxBranchingAngle
double.label: Maximum branching angle
double.description: Develop/Debug Only: Maximum branching angle, in degrees. When using multiple tensors, a new branch will be created when the tensors' major directions form an angle between (minBranchingAngle, maxBranchingAngle). Branching is supressed when this maxBranchingAngle is set to 0.0. Default: 0.0. Range: 0-90.

double.name: minBranchingAngle
double.label: Minimum branching angle
double.description: Develop/Debug Only: Minimum branching angle, in degrees. When using multiple tensors, a new branch will be created when the tensors' major directions form an angle between (minBranchingAngle, maxBranchingAngle). Default: 0. Range: 0-90.

geometry.name: tractsWithSecondTensor
geometry.label: Branched Fibers (second tensor, optional)
geometry.description: Develop/Debug Only: Tracts generated, with second tensor output (if there is one)

boolean.name: storeGlyphs
boolean.label: Store tensors' main directions
boolean.description: Develop/Debug Only: Store tensors' main directions as two-point lines in a separate file named glyphs_{tracts}. When using multiple tensors, only the major tensors' main directions are stored

boolean.name: writeAsciiTracts
boolean.label: Write Binary Tracts File
boolean.description: Develop/Debug Only: Write tract file as ASCII text format. Default is not ASCII. Default tracts are written on VTK binary data file.

boolean.name: writeUncompressedTracts
boolean.label: Write uncompressed Tracts File
boolean.description: Develop/Debug Only: Write tract file as a VTK uncompressed data file

double.label: DEPRECATED REMOVED: minGA (was Stopping Criterion: Terminating GA)
double.description: DEPRECATED REMOVED: this parameter is no longer valid! Please use 'stoppingThreshold' instead! GA is no longer used as a stopping threshold. Please see https://github.com/pnlbwh/ukftractography/pull/64 for more information. (Was: Tractography parameter used in all models. Tractography will stop when the generalized anisotropy (GA) is less than this value. GA is a normalized variance of the input signals (so it does not depend on any model). Note: to extend tracking through low anisotropy areas, this parameter is often more effective than the minFA. This parameter is used by both tensor and NODDI models. Default: 0.1. Range: 0-1.)

boolean.name: shadowExec
boolean.label: Set inputs but don't actually run
boolean.description: Set inputs but don't actually run
